creditline: Gift of funds from the Regis Corporation
description: The Iliad Room at the Pitti Palace in Florence, Italy
marks: LR, in dark brown: F Maestosi
text: The Iliad Room is in the Pitti Palace in Florence, Italy. The room is named after paintings on the ceiling and in the lunettes that depict scenes from Homer's epic, "The Iliad". The sculpture in the center of the room is by Lorenzo Bartolini (1777-1850) and represents Charity.
title: Sala dell'Iliade in the Pitti Palace, Florence
